content.description_html: Explore statistically significant features. If you have an InChIKey for your compound, choose Perturbation. If you have a JCP ID, choose JCPID_2022. If you have neither, go here to look up the JCP ID for your compound or a close analog. Data Index. Download source profiles. JUMP Hub for more information and tutorials. Latest version of this page.
content.title: COMPOUND Feature Ranking

columns.Compartment: Mask used to calculate the feature. It can be Nuclei, Cytoplasm or Cells (the union of both Nuclei and Cytoplasm).
columns.Feature: Morphological feature obtained from CellProfiler. This value is the result after data normalization. Its units are the number of median absolute deviations (MAD) from the median.
columns.Channel: Image channel, which shows the stain for DNA, Mito (mitochondria), RNA, AGP (actin, Golgi, plasma membrane) or ER (Endoplasmic Reticulum).
columns.Suffix: Suffix associated with a CellProfiler feature.
columns.Feature significance: Statistical significance of the difference between a morphological feature in a perturbation compared to the control condition. Lower values suggest a stronger effect of the perturbation on that particular feature. The p-value goes through the Benjamini-Hochberg FDR correction
columns.Perturbation: Chemical or genetic perturbation. If genetic (overexpression or knock-out) it is the NCBI gene symbol. If it is a chemical perturbation this is the InChiKey.
columns.Corrected p-value: Statistical significance of how distinctive a perturbation is relative to the negative control. It correlates negatively to mean average precision, but adjusted based on its composition of positive and negative values.
columns.Phenotypic activity: Mean average precision of the perturbation. It determines its distinctiveness to the negative control. An empty value indicates that the value was discarded due to low infection efficiency.
columns.Perturbation example image: Sample image of the perturbation. It cycles over the available images for every occurrence of the perturbation.
columns.Median: Median value of the feature for the perturbation when aggregating all replicates.
columns.Gene Rank: The rank of the feature for a given gene when compared to that feature in all other genes.
columns.Feature Rank: The rank of feature significance when compared to all the features for a given perturbation.
columns.JCP2022: JUMP id. This identifier is unique for any given reagent for a genetic or chemical perturbation across all three datasets (ORF, CRISPR and compounds) and is only repeated for biological replicates.
columns.Resources: External links that provide further information on the gene or chemical perturbation (e.g., NCBI, ChEMBL).
columns.Synonyms: Other names of the perturbation. If it is a number it indicates that the gene name was not found.
